review: I begin taking this drug 10 years ago when I thought I was seriously ill. I had numerous medical tests done, but in the end my doctor was right and it was just anxiety and panic attacks. I don’t say JUST lightly. I know you are reading this post because you are miserable with suffering, and struggling so much right now. Please know that you are in good company, and so many people are suffering just as you are. I highly encourage you to give this medication a solid chance. I’m not gonna lie, the first 2 to 3 weeks were pretty brutal. Increased anxiety at times, then better at times. Then one day, I had an entire afternoon where  I felt perfectly normal. The next day I had a little anxiety, but those good days grew longer and longer until I realized I wasn’t constantly keeping score about my anxiety. Back and forth for a while, just like the tide. My ideal dose is 20 mg, but I usually take 10 when things are relatively calm; 20 when things get really bad. YOU’VE GOT THIS! Hugs

I have suffered with anxiety for most of my life I am now 29. I stopped driving and going places alone because I would have such severe panic attacks  I tried Prozac in the past but felt it wasn’t for me. I am on day 3 of 10mg lexapro at night. The first night and next day was  a complete nightmare DO NOT STOP TAKING IT! Do not get discouraged. I feel much better day 3 other than my appetite has not returned just yet. I am calm and I am more patient I am not on edge wanting to fight or flight! I am still out of work because I am adjusting to the lexapro and want to be able to start eating more to gain my strength. I will leave another review in a month to let y’all know how it’s going. Sending lots of love! We got this! And we can get our lives back!

Hi, my experience was very awful and bad. My doctor gave me lexapro 10mg I only took it for 3 days. Since the first day I lost my love and my interest in everything. I quit it I also got depression from it and very bad dreams. I am 9 months off now with no improvement for the things the drug caused to me. Stay away .

I have never experienced this much peace.  I am 38 years old and have struggled with anxiety my whole life… the craziest part is that I have just pushed through it all these years.  I have been very successful In Business and in life, but I have never been at peace with myself or my surroundings.  I am on day 9 of lexapro 10mg and I feel like a different person.  After 2 years of anxiety that wouldn’t allow me to sleep, panic attacks, and anxiety related depression…. Enough was enough.  If you’re struggling with GAD give this a try.  It might just save your life like it has saved mine.  The first week was brutal.  I was crawling out of my skin, terrible dreams, sweating, couldn’t get our bed for 2 days… but 9 days in and I am in a mental place that I never thought possible.  Trust me, you don’t deserve to live with anxiety and fear like most of us here do.  Seek help, you will find peace you deserve

I started with Lexapro  5mg since I am very sensitive to medication just to start there. I took it for two days along with wellbutrin 150mg xl that I have been taking for like 6 months and although it made my anxiety dissipate it also shorten my emotional span. It didn't blunt me but I felt more mellow. BUT it gave me a terrible cerebral feeling like if my brain was fried. Couldn't continue cause this feeling made me feel like dying. Not suicidal but it sucked. But if you can push through that then you may reap the benefits.

This pill saved my life, there’s no doubt in my mind. I was experiencing daily, intense anxiety and panic, my latest episode left me so shaken and traumatized, I immediately scheduled an appointment with my doctor to talk about medication options. I won’t lie, the first week was very tough. Heightened anxiety, shaky, no appetite, both fatigue and insomnia. I almost gave up by day 3. With the help of my support system, I stuck it out, and saw noticeable changes in my behavior by week two. My appetite was coming back, I was able to sleep, and my anxiety episodes never progressed to the point of hysteria. By weeks three and four, I felt hopeful about the future again. The mornings and evenings were still a bit nerve filled, but during the day I could function, and I had my motivation back. In entering week five, and I haven’t had more than a slight stomach ache in the morning when I first wake up. I keep wondering, is this how normal people feel every day?.

Wow!!! It took over 30 years to be diagnosed with the CORRECT medical condition. I've tried countless Prescriptions, therapies, you name it! Lexapro has been a REAL lifesaver. I've been taking the 20mg pill for 6 months now. I no longer have road rage and petty things that used to drive me batty no longer do. Guys!! That alone speaks volumes! I thoroughly enjoy not getting irritated over petty crap. I lost two of the closest people in my life a few months apart last year, and instead of losing my mind, I cried here and there, but that was it!! Definitely a much more pleasant person to be around. LOL.

Within four hours after taking 5 mg I couldn’t lift my head and I could barely get out of bed for the next 24 hours I cried multiple times uncontrollably and felt like rubbish. I’m 5’ 2 and 130 pounds

I was taking the drug for anxiety and depression. I'd rate both as moderate. After two doses of 10mg I woke up on the third day with side effects much worse than the original problem. The main effect is an intense whole body distress that goes in waves. I could do nothing but curl up and moan. The rest of the day was spent staring off into space.  The second major effect was to turn my mild tinnitus into a scream. There are other side effects that I will not note but are not as bad as these two. Overall the worst drug I have ever taken by a huge margin.I stopped after the first two pills and am still waiting for the side effects to go away. It's been eight days now and thing are better but I am hoping to get back to the original anxiety/depression.Fifteen years ago I had a bad reaction to another SSRI so I have learned one useful lesson, don't ever take this class of drug again

I have always had generalized anxiety my whole life which limited me to not being able to enjoy life like I should be. I decided to try Lexapro out and WOW I wish I did sooner. I was scared to start taking this medication  due to the side effects I read about. I started with 2.5mg for the first 2 weeks then up to 5mg then finally up to the perfect dose for me of 10mg. I had no side effects at all dosing this way and my anxiety and depression is all gone and I am living and enjoying life now the way I should have.

In my case, it ruined my life after a few months, especially when I had to suddenly stop taking it to get away from what it was doing to me. Works incredible for a lot of people so don't let this scare you, try it! On sertraline now since 1 year, life is so good!

This is a miracle medication for me.  I am in my mid-40s and I have a biological kind of anxiety and depression.  I've been seeing a psychologist for 5 years and have a lot of useful coping techniques that I thought would see me through if I ever came off medication.  I came off Zoloft very slowly after being on it for > 5 years.  At first I was fine but then my anxiety crept back in and hit with a vengeance.  I had dreadful insomnia and my anxiety and depression were off the charts.  Nothing in my life had changed.  I literally woke up one day with a cloud hanging over me that just got worse and worse. No amount of diet, exercise, meditation or CBT did a thing.   I tried all of the non-serotonin antidepressants like Bupropion and Agomelatine and they did nothing.   Four weeks into taking Lexapro, my anxiety and depression had completely resolved.  I am happily married, have 2 wonderful children and a great career that I can now enjoy.  I will happily stay on this medication forever.

Leaxapro helped me a lot, I was at first scared to take any medications. (I also have ADHD). My doctor also diagnosed me with GAD, so ADHD and GAD were not a good mix. Took 26 years for me to get help. Started at 5mg, it worked great for 7 months, then in January I noticed I was starting to get anxious about small things in my life, mostly surrounding my pet birds. Doctor monitored me, and decided to up my dose to 10 mg, it's my 9th day and I'm feeling okay. Mild side effects like being sleepy, stomach problems and headaches.  Since starting I've been able to come out of my shell and not build walls up around myself to keep people out, it's made me more confident and I can enjoy things stress free now.

I started Lexapro a little over a week ago, the first few nights I had night sweats, wake up at 4 am every morning, increase anxiety, numbness, sensation in face at times when stressed, thinking the worst going to happen, and even had a mild panic attack. I find comfort in my bed and afraid if I leave the house I'm going to have a panic attack which just increases my anxiety. I'm still taking 5mg at night and reading the reviews are helping me stick with it. I'm trusting the process and can wait to get my life back. When should I feel a relief.

My doctor switched me over to Lexapro after my 20mg of paxil stopped working after about 20 years.  I was excited to take it cause I thought that it would work the way paxil did when I first started taking it.  Unfortunately that ended up not being the case.  At 30mg of lexapro I felt some improvement and so my doctor put me on 40mg.  That worked better for a while but not 100 percent.  After about 4 months on 40mg I realized that things were not going to get better, and so I was taken off lexapro.

Lexapro gave me my life back! I was struggling with GAD for some months and tried other medications before my psychiatrist prescribed Lexapro. I was dealing with panic attacks everyday and literally didn’t know what to do with my life anymore. The first day I felt a difference, it was like a breath of fresh air. The next couple weeks I still had some off days but by the end of week 4 I was able to live regularly again. If you’re just starting Lexapro just remember it’s not a miracle drug. It takes time. Give it 4-6 weeks and try not to give up while waiting to see results. I still suffer from panic attacks and anxiety but it is so much easier to bear. Don’t let all of the negative reviews scare you. What may not work for someone else may work for you!

Let me start that it takes quite some time for the meds to kick in . First 4 weeks were brutal for me . Between constant fear and anxiety and non stop crying and lost of appetite I thought I am going crazy, but after 4 weeks things got better a bit.  Less tired,  less tears.  Week 6 was very good and hopeful. My energy levels were higher,  started to smile again . Less naps during the day ( I could sleep 14 hours and that wasn't enough in my first 4 weeks) I am on week 8 , my anxiety is manageable.  Still there but less scary . Therapy helps too . Lost 20 lbs within 7 weeks , not feeling hungry but energy levels are much much better. So please give this medicine a try . It might not work right away and changes might not be noticeable right away but over time you will see the difference.  I started on 2.5 mg then bumped it to 5 mg and now I am on 7.5 mg.  Treated for panic disorder and severe anxiety.

I am 2 weeks in to my 10mg Lexapro. I will say everyday for the first 7 days I wanted to quit! I was tired so, so, so tired felt so much anxiety had panic attacks almost every morning. Like I said I'm 2 weeks in and I literally feel like a new person a new happy person who again wants to go outside I want to talk to friends again.I spent so long no wanting to be around my family friends didn't want to do my job didn't want to shop didn't wanna cook or eat I finally told my doctor I don't feel like a person anymore at all I had no drive to do anything at all.If your struggling please don't stop taking it... I promise life starts in roughly 10 days!!! I get up now I'm not tired I can eat my stomach doesn't stay in knots and I'm not living in my head worried about everything possible and no panic attacks thank goodness!Stay strong you got this!!! These post are the reason I'm at this point...thank you everyone for your stories.

I’m I was diagnosed with generalized anxiety disorder at age 11. I had been on paroxetine up until the age 18, when it stopped working, apparently because I was on it too long. For over 2 years I was struggling to find the right medication. It was hurting my mental health to constantly switch medications and go through the trial and error process. Prozac, Zoloft, Lamictal… You name it. Lexapro saved me and helped me become a functioning member of society again. I no longer suffer from panic attacks or have a horrible pit in my stomach whenever I go into a situation that would’ve made me pass out. Side effects were minimal to none. A headache and stomachache here and there, but other than that, I was seeing results within 2 weeks. After it was in my system I have absolutely no side effects. Miracle drug for me.

Stick with it is the best advise I was given.  I was started on 20mg 3 weeks ago and the side effects and changes were difficult and I missed a couple days of work. (Mine were/are  tiredness, dizziness, no sex drive, nausea, diarrhea-1st week only, constant yawning) but this week I feel amazing!   I had quite a bit going on as you can tell by the high dose. I still have some of my anxieties and spurts of depression but I haven't been on it very long. It has really taken the edge off and helped me feel calm.  I felt like I was at my breaking point. Seeing a Doctor was the best thing I did. Feeling like I did was no way to live and I did for many years.  I started out taking lexapro in the mornings, but the pharmacy called and said I should try at night. But I may switch back to mornings because I cant fall asleep now.  Overall it was worth the wait and the side effects  I'm feeling much better than I did.

I felt it only fair to leave my review when I used these reviews to get me through. I was terrified of starting medication and more so by some bad reviews. I tried Zoloft & reacted really badly which solidified my views of not using meds. I tried every holistic approach & after 12 months of living with panic disorder I couldn’t live with it anymore, every day was exhausting and constantly living in fear of another attack. I’m only day 12 on lexapro, the first week is rough, my anxiety heightened and I had to have valium to help relax, it gets worse before better. Every day when I wondered if & when this drug would work I read the good reviews for encouragement & I promise the hard times pass. I have slowly felt better the past few days but today I feel amazing, I feel clear & I had a beautiful day at the beach with my family, I’m so excited for this new mind frame. Stay strong, when you get to the other side it’s so so worth it.

I’m around three weeks of 2.5mg of lexapro. It started to ease my severe anxiety almost instantly. Three weeks on I feel like I am different person and like I can cope with life. Before this I had severe anxiety, some depression and hopelessness and obsessive compulsive thoughts and behaviours.  I feel very different and so much better. Please if you are struggling give this a chance as it could really help. I was scared too but very glad I tried it and its helped me even on a tiny dose. Side effects for the first week or so were fatigue but thats gone now. Only side effects now are a tense jaw and a slight twitching in my eye lid which has come and gone for a couple of days (although this could be due to stress and tiredness too). Would really recommend lexapro

I was trialling Zoloft for 7 weeks, couldn't handle the diarrhoea  (TMI- like yellow baby poo kind) and barely eating for weeks. My doc advised my body probably isn't absorbing the 100mg I was on, still having panic attacks rarely also. I am currently tapering off Zoloft to 50mg for 2 weeks, while taking 10mg of lexapro. It's only day one and I don't know if it was the reassurance from my doc (I had a lump in my hand near a vein and I convinced myself it was a blood clot after astra vaccination, doc thinks it's a ganglion cyst) that made me relax but I don't feel the need to overthink random muscle twitches to the point it becomes a panic attack. Only day 1 so not expecting every day to be jolly, but fingers crossed they are, update to come. I do have Valium in the mean time and shower during a panic attack, only place I feel safe when it comes on (plus listening to panic attack guided music, reassurance)

I promised I would come here & write a review if I experienced any form of relief on Lexapro. When at my absolute rock bottom, I would spend hours reading reviews begging & pleading for any semblance of hope during such a horrifically dark time.I was POSITIVE with every fiber of my being that it wouldn’t work for me & that I would be a shell of myself - anxious, panicky with doom dread & hopelessness forever. I was certain of it.The first 4 weeks were absolutely brutal. I held on by a thread as my body adjusted to the medication. I had morning dread, nausea, zero appetite, anxiety, hopelessness + more.I started feeling relief at 4 weeks almost exactly. I had to use lorazepam to sleep during this time and am weaning slowly off now, but at 8 weeks on Lexapro I feel 10000x better. I cope now. I get through the day with little to no anxiety, and little to no depression. It took around 6 weeks to get what I would say is relief & I am SO grateful. I am so much better now!!

Hi Hope all doing well and getting there? I was on Lexapro for just over 7 months, It never really worked for me but gave it a good go to work, I stopped at the beginning of June now off for 4.5 months I tapered down from 10mg, 10mg to 5mg no problems, 5mg – 2.5mg very little issues, 2.5 to 1.25 really started to have issues, stayed 1,25mg for 6 weeks for stopping and all I can say it has been a brutal Journey, first 4 weeks, total confusion, ringing ears through low level anxiety and panic attacks, through week 8 – 12 having different symptoms every day all very uncomfortable and difficult to function with after 3 and half months I went private to a consultant as I was very concerned as how I was feeling after such a long period, he advised is common from Lexapro, he advised I was about enter the final Phase of withdrawal, symptoms included Severe anxiety, Panic attacks, low mood etc, I didn’t expect what happened to me, after about 10 days into this

I have been on and off Lexapro for 4 years. Every time I think I can stop and deal with life medication-free, I end up coming right back to Lexapro. I’ve tried other meds in the past, and I’ve determined that Lexapro is the one for me. I pair it with Bupropion and have such positive results. I have a bit more energy. I’ve been able to keep weight off. Mentally, wow. I feel so, so much better. I wake up feeling excited for the day. Things don’t bother me as much, and I can handle negative experiences in a calm way, and even get over them quickly. My anxiety is way lower, which is my favorite thing about this medication. Only downside for me is lower sex drive. It’s worth it to me to feel better and to enjoy life so much more. Unless you have adverse effects that you cannot function with, I recommend sticking with it. I felt better after just two weeks. But everyone is different. Hang in there. Things can and will turn around and get better. Love to you all.

I started off week one on a 5 mg dose just for an introduction not sure of what was going to happen. Week 2 and 3 I increased to the 10 mg. My anxiety seemed to get worse, I lost weight but stayed on Course. Week 4 my doctor increased to 20 mg. I experienced severe anxiety attacks, insomnia, trouble sleeping, night sweats. I have to admit it was awful, I thought I was dying. I stayed the course though after reading reviews and determined I have to give it time. It Took till week 7 to see a noticeable change. I am now on week 8 and am happy to say I have felt pretty much normal for a week and a half now. I highly recommend if trying this medication you give it at least 7 weeks to start working. I can’t imagine where I would be today without this med. I also recommend researching good foods for boosting Serotonin levels and change diet to suit.

After reading these reviews myself I felt obligated to share my experience. I'm a 29 year old male that has had no anxiety issues up until a couple months ago. After speaking with my PCP he prescribed me with Lexapro which I think has saved my life. I definitely made a mistake at first and was taking it in the morning and quickly realized that wasn't the best idea and had a rough couple nights. After Day 3 and switching to taking it at night I realized that this is the most effective way to take the drug. On Day 10, I noticed that all of my physical symptoms were almost 95% suppressed and I was feeling a lot happier. If you have anxiety, give this drug a shot. I was once in your shoes reading these reviews before I took Lexapro and the anxiety you build from just reading the negative reviews can trigger more anxiety attacks. Give it a go and make sure you at least give it two weeks.

Thank you to everyone who shared their experience!! I constantly read all of your stories and they filled me with hope. I had debilitating GAD and was afraid to do everyday tasks like cooking and driving. I was uncomfortable being alone and overwhelmed when anyone in my family wanted to hang out with me. I stopped talking to everyone and just stayed in my room. I was put on 5mg of Lexapro (generic) and my anxieties got worse. I was sweating a lot from my hands and feet, had racing thoughts about losing control, felt like I was never going to stop worrying. I had horrible insomnia and took melatonin nightly just to get a couple of hours of sleep a night. I began feeling better after 1 week at 5mg and increased to 10mg. I’ve been at 10mg for 5 days and on Lexapro for almost at 3 weeks total. I still have some insomnia and I have some brain fog but the fog usually lifts in the evening time. If you’re reading this, stick with it and get your life back!! Good luck

Wow. I lived with anxiety for 2 years and never realized I could find an ally in lexapro. I have struggled so much with white knuckling anxiety. Therapists told me to just ignore anxiety, but after almost passing out multiple times I couldn’t do it alone. Life with my level of anxiety was almost impossible. I shrunk into a barely recognizable version of myself. Back into a shell where I was safe and protected. Finally my doctor prescribed lexapro and it’s been so much easier. It’s not a magic pill but it turns the noise down 10-20% in all situations. I can handle 80% anxiety intensity with lexapro. I am only on 5mg now. only negative have been taking it on empty stomach which hurt bad.

Second day taking Lexapro; I feel a huge change but the side effects are difficult to deal with. Sweating, headaches, nausea, decreased appetite and insomnia. Hoping in a few days everything will subside. Everyone’s comments are giving me courage to carry on taking Lexapro. Thank you everyone!

Day 10. As others have said, the first few days were rough. The biggest issue I faced was constant hunger and maybe I gained a pound or two before I realized that much of the hunger pain can be satiated with water. My other mistake was taking it at 5pm made me drowsy as heck and feel kinda weird and hungry. Now I take it before bed and right on day 7, one week later, the hunger pain is gone.As for its effectiveness 10 days in? I think it might be too early to tell but I don't feel so worked up about going outside. In order to learn more I have to run more tests such as going to the store or simply pushing my own boundaries.I hope to remember to update this a few months from now. Stick with it, set an alarm 1hr before bed to take the pill. And heed the advice of others on here while remembering that everyone is different. Good luck.

Having struggled with mild anxiety my entire life, this was always manageable until I reached my mid twenties, my mild anxiety started to become more severe. It had gotten to the point where I felt anxious nearly every waking hour, often for no reason. I could not find a way to control it. I would be nauseous, shaking, crying, sometimes even crossing over into depressive and dark episodes. I was sick of feeling this way and didn't see a way out. I decided to visit my doctor and was prescribed 10mg of Lexapro daily. I didn't experience any side effects apart from some fatigue and was beginning to feel better in a matter of days. Now, I barely feel anxiety at all. Sometimes I get a little nervous but it is fleeting and very easy to control. I feel happy, calm and capable of doing things before with ease that I couldn't have imagined. That little anxious voice in my head isn't there anymore. If you're considering this medication, definitely go for it. It made me feel like me again

I have GAD. I have been anxious all my life. It has become a problem over the last 5 years or so as the symptoms became physical. I will hurt in random spots all the time; the top of my head, my joints, my muscles, my neck, my stomach, different random spots throughout my body. I have gone to doctors for these issues over the years to no avail. After some blood work or ultrasounds, they would say its stress and that would make me angry. They weren't taking me serious. I was offered SSRIs a few times and turned them down out of fear and denial. Fear that it would make me a zombie. Fear that without my anxiety i wouldnt be productive. Eventually I started seeing a therapist and she talked me into it. She said to try it and if it didn't help to stop. So I went for it. I started on 5 mg of Lexapro for about 2 months then to 10mg. I am a new person. I am so much happier. Try it and stick with it.

Just want to start by saying titrate upwards slow on this drug if you have a sensitive stomach. I thought starting at 20mg would be a good idea since I've been on it previously for a year. That was a mistake (I vomited 3 days in a row). Dr re-prescribed it at 5mg. I cut the 5mg in half and started 2 days on 2.5mg. I feel fine already 2 days into 2.5mg. I'm able to sit outside with my dogs without panicking. This drug helped me before and it's already helping me again. Its like a light bulb turned on in my brain again. I'm very thankful and hopeful again. ☺  Thank you science.

I struggled with the worst anxiety I've ever had this past year, and without lexapro, I honestly don't know where I would be right now. I see that a lot of people on here don't understand that you have to give this drug time. It doesn't work within 1 week, it takes usually 4 to 6 weeks to start seeing the benefits of lexapro. But the benefits are absolutely worth the wait. If you just started taking lexapro, and it doesn't feel like it's working, like I said, just give it time. There's also mild side effects in the beginning stages of taking lexapro, but they do eventually go away, so don't worry about that.

I’ve been diagnosed with GAD since I was 16. I first tried sertraline and that worked for me until I was 18 when I stopped taking it. Once my anxiety relapsed again a year later, sertraline didn’t work for me anymore. I then switched to Wellbutrin but that didn’t work for me after 6 months of waiting. I honestly thought I would never recover from my anxiety… until I tried lexapro!!! The very first week, I felt happier, I had more energy, I was talking more, I even told others that it felt like it was harder to be sad or to get stuck in that dark place when I’m anxious. Fast forward to 1 month on the drug, I haven’t even felt anxious for a moment. I feel like my old self!!! I have energy, I want to go out and do things, I just feel happy. I’m so glad I tried this drug. I was in a dark place struggling with my anxiety where I told myself I’d rather not live than to survive each day struggling with my anxiety…. If you’re reading this, DONT GIVE UP!!!

This medication as saved my life! Literally! I was in a dark, deep depression along with severe anxiety.  I couldn’t get through my day without constant worry and couldn’t get through my nights without wanting to die.  I started on 5mg for two weeks then went to 10mg.  All the anxiety is gone and the depression is subsiding .  I’m enjoying life again, laughing and going out.  I’m way more focused at work.  I’ve been on it for 6 weeks now.  My only regret as that I’ve lost so much of my life I wish I had found this sooner.  Yes there are some side effects - primarily some headaches and ejaculation problems but these far out weigh the benefits.

I started taking this medicine three days ago, after reading reviews I’m definitely glad I made the choice, I haven’t had to take a single pill for my anxiety, I’m all around calmer. I feel like I can see everything clearly and my mind is no longer clouded, but I’m assuming it’s just how I would feel if I didn’t have depression and anxiety? It’s an odd feeling because it’s something I’m not use to feeling. I take it around 5 pm it does upset my stomach, to the point where I’ve thrown up once, it also makes me yawn like crazy (which is why night time seems like the best time) the next morning I feel great, lack of appetite but I still make sure to eat…. I know it’s still early in my journey but so far so good!

I was having panic attacks pretty much non stop out of nowhere. I couldn’t drive without having to pull over multiple times or be on the phone with someone because I’d constantly go into a panic. And this came out of NO WHERE! I was so depressed I couldn’t be alone and working was horrible. I started seeing a doctor who tried me on a couple of different things but I was so scared to start lexapro in case it make me worse, because people always say sometimes you get worse before you get better and getting any worse than what I was scared the crap out of me. But I woke up one morning and just cried because I was so lost so I got to the point where I was like what else do I have to lose. Now I’m telling you lexapro SAVED ME. From someone who was against medicine I have now helped so many other people give it a chance and they’re so thankful. I will always say this pill has changed my life. I could honestly say it helped too much

I am 41 years old and have lived with anxiety-related disorders my entire life. I had always refused medication and relied solely on non-therapeutic management. VERY reluctantly I decided to try Lexapro because my mom (who has a very low tolerance of prescriptions) had a positive experience with this medication. I started on 10mg. I experienced a positive difference -- feeling "more myself" and less consumed by unwelcomed thought patterns -- was within a week, and very much so after being on the medication for 6 weeks. I didn't even realize how much of a difference Lexapro had made until I found myself finding JOY in life again. After being on the medication for about a year, I experienced difficult anxiety symptoms. My physician recommended I go to 20 mg daily. Again, I was very reluctant to increase, but did end up going up to 20. It's now been almost two years on 20mg/daily. I do not experience any side effects and consider my anxiety-related disorders under excellent control.

I was prescribed 10mg Lexapro, but I started at 2.5mg nightly and the only side effect for that was I would get a little sleepy. After 3 days, I went to 3.75mg. Again, nothing significant. 3 days later I started 5mg. The second day after starting the 5mg, I went to the salon. I ended up having two panic attacks before going inside. I felt sort of faint and not well. I was alone and 45 minutes away from home. I ended up canceling at appointment time, which I have never done and driving myself home. My Blood pressure which is usually normal was 150/94 while my pulse was only 62. At that point, I decided to stop the medication. I went back down to 2.5mg and stopped three days later. While some people have no issues, I was not one of them. I am also a CYP2C19 ultrarapid metabolizer gene *17/*17. I am not sure if this is why, but I could not go through having symptoms worse than the actual anxiety itself. Cozy Chamomile tea works best for my anxiety without side effects.

I was always an anxious person, I had panic attacks at night sometimes, but never sought any help, and this all got worse last year with the pandemic. Last month I've had buildup anxiety 3 weeks straight and finally decided to seek help. I'm on day 4 of escitalopram 5mg, the first 2 days were terrible, I only slept like 2 hours, had nausea, couldn't eat, was feeling horrible during the day and it felt like my anxiety had worsened, I was in agony, couldn't sit still or distract myself. But yesterday I could catch more sleep (woke up some 3 times but forced myself back to sleep). I’ve suffered with GAD for over 15 years. I was reluctant to ever medicate because I felt that would just be masking the issue and I wanted to address the root cause. Lexapro seemed to be working at first for my depression, but gradually the side effects have become unbearable.  I have been on Lexapro for over 9 months. It can work for some, but not me.  The withdrawal symptoms are manageable when Lexapro is tapered down.

I have extreme anxiety and chronic depression I can not tell you how much this medication has saved me from harming myself. I’ve been on it now for 5 years started at 2mg daily and now up to 10mg recently after losing my job and this coronavirus pandemic. Overall this pill isn’t magic but it’s helped me and my anxiety and compulsive thinking. It doesn’t give those weird side effects like blank thinking or weird dreams. All this medication has done is ground myself and thoughts and I’m thankful for that. Oh and if your worried that it makes you gain weight it did not make me gain any weight at all.

My life was literally wrecked by depression and anxiety when it turned its ugly head when I was 17 years old. I've been through terrible times and through a living nightmare. Now I'm 32 years old on Lexapro and I feel good finally.

3 years on Lexapro, I have a life. I am so grateful that I found a doctor who really worked with me to find something that worked. And also for convincing me to stay in it as I had so many conflicting beliefs around using antidepressants.My moods are stable, it’s helped me during 2 pregnancies and with postnatal anxiety.I notice my mood swings and insomnia creep back if I’m not taking regularly.It’s a lifesaver for me and it took me approx 9 days to start feeling normal when I first took it.The initial side effects do stop. Sex drive did come back.

I have had anxiety, insomnia and I guess depression for life. I'm 42 and finally told my PCP I felt like I was going to lose it after a lot of drama plus COVID quarantine. I was on zoloft (generic) for weeks and the side effects were unbearable, I almost checked myself into the hospital it was so bad. I was switched to lexapro (generic) and feel like a new woman! Calm cool and collected. Wish I had these in my 20s I would have a different life lol.

I started 5 mg of Lexapro for social anxiety a month ago, with no side effects.My doctor increased to 10 mgs. And after 2 yrs, I'm still uses it, and my social anxiety is subsidedAmazing, I was a mess!

Lexapro was the first meds I took to help with my anxiety and panic attacks and worked great. I did get side effects for only the first week, I had nausea and headaches, the side effects were tolerable though. Little by little I felt like I was able to get my life back. The only side effect that made me want to stop was a decrease in my sex drive. If it weren't for that it would be a 10/10 for me.

Life and work progressively got worse over the last 18 months, withdrawn, moody, insomnia, short with family, lack of concentration, anxiety and suicidal thoughts and plans. Had major panic attack ended up in hospital the symptoms similar to heart attack, even had a angiogram.Started cocktail of meds and ended with 10mg of Lexapro and now on 20mg. It has really settled me however still struggle to complete tasks and off work. Counselling also assisting.I have a review this week but diarrhea, insomnia slight nausea have continued. If can fix the diarrhea be very happy.I take meds in the am

I will update in a few weeks with my full experience with starting Lexapro. Let me tell you, I was TERRIFIED to start this medication due to bad reviews. I am terrified of feeling ill and ESPECIALLY vomiting. I finally told myself this morning I can no longer live in fear of my own life, constantly anxious, and told myself to just take the medicine. I was prescribed 10 mg, but personally medications do cause significant side effects for me (I am 5’4 and 100 pounds soaking wet) so I broke it down to 2.5 mg to start. I have experienced NO terrible side effects, it’s been roughly eight hours. I have had some burning sensation in my stomach, but I also have terrible stomach issues as is. I have been tired as well, but depression does that to a person.. PLEASE TAKE THIS MEDICATION. IT MAY HELP YOU. IT MAY SAVE YOUR LIFE. You. Can. Do. This.. *I will update in a few weeks with results as of then*

Hi there! Just a disclaimer, I am NOT a doctor, nor do I specialize in anything beyond my own experience. This is my own perspective that I want to share for those who were just like me. I take 2.5 mg of Lexapro. The first aspect I'd like to clarify, is that taking a pill is not magic. I work out 2-3 times a week, I eat healthy and I make a conscious effort to do skills my therapist teaches me like grounding, CBT, and balance. My anxiety is still there. However, the crippling act of having anxiety that would physically make me drop to my knees and ruminate in my brain for days in a row, has subsided.Side effects of weird dreams, icy-hot feeling and anxiousness did happen in the first week. This may not work for everyone, as everyone is different. I have read those same crazy reviews that scare you. I have circled on the act of why and when and how and what if.  I still have fears. I still get anxious. However, the place I was at I wish for no one in the world to have to go through.

First antidepressant I ever took. Ruined my libido, caused suicidal thoughts. I had to go to the hospital because I wanted to commit suicide. I had nightmares every night about a trauma I experienced when I was 16. Horrible, and I always tell people to stop taking after they notice bad symptoms- I wish I did.

After suffering for several years due to Anxiety Disorder, Panic Disorder and some OCD I decided to try an SSRI. First, I tried another older drug (Amitriptyline), which helped a lot, but the side-effects were too intense, so my doctor switched me to Lexapro. I did not have severe side-effects when I switched, but there were several that were annoying: Eyes don't adjust to light as well (reading in a dark room is harder and looking at fluorescent light is a bit painful), lower libido, weight-gain, drowsy for a few hours after taking the pill. After using this drug for about 5 months, light sensitivity has improved (but not gone away) and I don't get drowsy anymore. But, I still have somewhat lower libido and I put on about 10kg (23 lb) in that time. My dose is 10mg every morning.

2019 Took toll on my life in every aspect. I am 45 years old & my career crashed, my husband left me & I am battling legal issues. My husband locked me out of utility accounts til’ shut off notices arrived. I could not think straight at all. My stress & worries took over me. I began deep depression and the worries would overwhelm me to a point I wanted to sleep, but I had insomnia. My mind would race, I closed myself off to the world and prayed heavily. I could no longer have normal conversations. I pushed everyone away. I finally called my Dr, realizing it was more than I could handle. I’ve only been on it one week & can truly say LEXAPRO SAVED MY LIFE. I do not feel different at all. I feel Normal. I can think. I can decipher between tasks of importance and have been more productive than I have in a year. I sleep better. I go to bed with a clearer picture & less worry. The stress & reality is all still there, but each day I am managing and making progress now!

I just wanted to share my experience with people who are just starting out on Lexapro.  This is my 20th day on Lexapro and I must say that the first two weeks are pretty rough.  The first week it made my anxiety to the point I've never felt before with nausea, fatigue, headache with a fog.  Had insomnia was well.  The second week the anxiety started to subside and nausea was gone but started to get hunger pains so drank a lot of water instead of grabbing food every time I got the hunger pain.  I also got some days with dizziness in week two and fog and headache with fatigue during the mornings (I take it first thing in morning) and would subside by afternoon.  Insomnia started to get better.  By the start of week number three all the side effects started to diminish little each and every day.  At this point pretty much all side effects are gone and no anxiety. It took about 3 weeks for me and now its great.  10mg day.

I was on paxil for 5 years before switching to lexapro due to unwanted to side-effects (loss of sex drive, anhedonia, night sweats and hand tremors). Lexapro has proven to be just as effective as the paxil in controlling my anxiety/panic-disorder, with nearly none of the side-effects that paxil caused!

After suffering with OCD since childhood (I'm now 36) and have been through various long lasting periods of depression and bouts of extreme OCD. I gave up on the few times I'd tried other therapies. I finally just asked my Dr if I could try anti depressants. She offered 5mg of Lexapro for 2 weeks and in view to up dosage afterwards if I felt ok. 5mg seemed to not have any side effects, but the difference in my anxiety was not greatly improved. So I upped to 10mg in the morning. A month in and I can honestly say I have been better than I have been in ages. Really amazed at the results. Don't expect euphoria, as its not a happy pill unless you have an imbalance. But I feel like I must have, as I really feel a whole lot better, and still feel like the same person. Just without all the stupid worries. Highly recommend for anxiety and OCD. I wish I took it 20 years ago.

Been on 10 mg Lexaprofor 8 months and overall it’s been an excellent medication. The first two weeks were tough - I don’t think one is warned sufficiently by the medics that you’re likely going to feel worse than before you started - but gradually I started to see the benefits kick in. No longer sweating the small stuff or waking up with a feeling of dread. The only thing that stops me giving this full marks is the reduction in libido and the feeling of slightly ‘can’t be bothered’ but the upside of no longer having nightmares or being filled with dread every morning is hugely appreciated.

So after 9 months of bullying/harassment at work from 3 different bosses, I was at breaking point. I was even having massive anxiety attacks at people taking too long in the self checkout at the supermarket. So went to the GP who prescribed Zoloft 50mg, tried for a week horrendous, threw them in the bin. Went to another GP who prescribed Lexapro 10mg, along with Zopiclone 7.5mg for sleep. As he said Lexapro will take a week or 2 to acclimatise. Started Sunday morning-felt weird after a few hours-dizzy-peripheral hallucinations-slept like a log. Monday morning-same deal, almost whited out at the supermarket-slept good. Tuesday morning-feel good, little dizzy, energetic in the arvo. But the dizziness has gone. Had kind of a dry mouth all 3 days, but just kept the liquids up. Lexapro seems heaps more tolerable than Zoloft, not even a hint of anxiety the last 2 days. Hope this keeps up, good luck to everyone on the same journey X

This medicine has been life altering. I have been taking it for over 3 years and cannot imagine where I would be without it. I experience no negative side effects with this medication and am able to conduct a normal life. I used to stay up for hours before bed with my mind racing and vomit from social apprehension. I have only had 2-3 anxiety attacks since I began the medication and while I still experience anxiety and nerves it is a healthy amount. I am so happy to have found a drug that allows me to conduct a normal life and still feel like myself!

After years of anxiety I finally went to the doctor in 2016 and started lexapro at 10mg..after 2 years I moved up to 20mg along with therapy which almost seemed to take away anxiety completely. After 3 years I stopped taking lexapro, because I felt so good. The first month off this medication I felt AMAZING. Then it all went down hill after month 2...My anxiety skyrocketed & I began feeling depressed. Then I tried Zoloft, which made it even worse. It gave me the shakes, caused daily panic attacks & suicidal ideations for the first time in my life (which I wouldn’t  wish on my worst enemy). Also I lost much of the weight lexapro caused.Fast forward..I am back on 20mg of Lexapro. I feel human again. I feel stable but I am gaining weight back (which sucks) and I feel fatigued again. BUT I feel like I can function normally. Even with the effects, lexapro is worth it for me. If you’re reading this, please don’t give up! Things can get better :) Its a trial and error.

Ok so I don’t ever do reviews. Like ever. But this medication has changed my life. I’ve been on it about 5 months now and I’m honestly amazed. I’ve suffered from extremely bad depression, anxiety, and ADHD. I’m also a recovering alcoholic/addict with 8 months sober. I went from being literally at rock bottom to all of a sudden living life again. For the first time in years, my body didn’t ache all day long, my anxiety went away, and I started to like sing in the car and get excited about nice sunny days! It’s crazy. I’m just super thankful. I take  10mg along with Wellbutrin and adderall. But Lexapro has been the game changer. Let your body go through a little nightmare for the first couple weeks. I promise you will all of a sudden hit a hump that you get over and it’s so nice. Don’t get me wrong, I still have my moments and struggles I’m life but I can deal with them now instead of breaking down. And I like people again. Give it a try.

I started off at 113lbs and my diet and exercise have always been constant but after 4 months on lexapro I weighed 155lbs. Had to switch medicines because I gained so much weight so fast. Works alright but I’m constantly sweating and fat now.

I promised myself if i made it out alive I’d come back and give my review, I’ve been on the meds a little over 2 months and the outcome has been very well for me! First couple of weeks are ruff but stick it out it’ll be well worth it!

This medication Lexapro was a horrible experience for me. I had auditory hallucinations and extreme paranoia. Not a fun time. Doctors kept saying they’d never heard of those side effects. So, to anyone experiencing anything like that, you’re not alone.

I suddenly couldn't eat any food, and cut out everything from my diet. The pain and heartburn went away and I could breath after eating again, but it resulted in me having such a limited diet that I was only eating chips with fake cheese for all meals. I was also terrified of driving and dying from an allergic reaction. We discovered that I was only allergic to dairy, but after six months of not having gluten soy fish or any meats, I was absolutely terrified of everything. My doctor prescribed me Lexapro. My panic attacks instantly stopped, but after two weeks was when it really kicked in. Suddenly I could drive without having panic attacks, and could eat meat and fish. Now I've just eaten gluten and soy after a month on lexapro, and despite having nightmares and panic attacks at the mere thought of accidentally consuming even a crumb of gluten, I feel zero anxiety whatsoever and am perfectly fine. Lexapro gave me my life back from my phobia of food.

I have been medications for anxiety since 18.  I am now 64.   Effexor was the best, but severe side effects when I had to stop taking it, weaned off over 6 weeks, thought I was going crazy.  Had to stop taking it because of no insurance.  Too expensive.     But now I started taking Lexapro since January this year (now 8 months,  and I got to say it has helped me so much with my anxiety.  Affordable, only side effect is my vision is more blurred.   No weight gain, no insomnia, no feeling weird.  It has allowed me to deal with the issues that cause my anxiety (my job) while not feeling the physical symptoms of the anxiety.  I hope this continues to work for a very long time.   It took a couple of weeks to level off in my system.

I have struggled with anxiety for my whole life but in the past 5 years it has gotten uncontrollable & I was crying every single day. I didn’t feel like me & felt so lost. I am 22 & in nursing school so there is a lot of pressure but this has been something I’ve wanted & knew I could achieve, but couldn’t do it with my anxiety. I was VERY skeptical about taking anything & have tried every alternative I could think of but I just couldn’t quite get there. I have been taking Lexapro 10 mg for over a month now & it has made my life 100x better. I haven’t cried once or felt extremely overwhelmed the entire time. The only side effects I experienced were sweating, dry mouth, & a slight headache. These have all subsided after the first week. This drug has made me feel like me again & I didn’t know if I would get here but I’m so glad I am. Don’t let the reviews scare you into not trying a medicine, it can help you if you let it. Give it time & push through. It’s so worth it.

I hope this helps people who feel scared.  A few months ago my anxiety got very bad, I couldn't enjoy life: worrying about travelling, weeks of insomnia, physical symptoms before starting the pills: nausea, irritability, sugar cravings, twitching, high sensitivity to sounds or sudden moves. I read the reviews here - terrifying.I started five weeks ago. 5mg - felt a bit sick. Scared for the first two days, a bit agitated - nothing serious. The pills can't hurt you. Most people tolerate them pretty well. The first days I felt extremely tired, but it didn't last.Things started looking up after a week. I increased to 10mg - after 3 weeks that made a difference - 90% better. CBT also helped a lot. I'm responding to anxiety very differently now. Meds are working. I watch my favorite shows again, read, travel, walk. Amazing - happy. I'm back to my old self - fun and engaging.

Lexapro has literally changed my life from the first 24 hours I started taking it. For the first time in my life, I understand what it’s like to have a quiet/calm mind, rather than coming from a place of anxiety. I’ve suffered from anxiety/depression/ptsd for years and just thought it was a normal way of living. Turns out, all I needed was Lexapro and all my other medical problems have drastically reduced! My IBS is completely gone, and I’m back to living a normal life! I seriously can’t express how grateful I am for this medication.

I have GAD and borderline personality disorder and my doctor suggested this medication. I developed a tic in my neck and became unable to control my facial and neck movements. I had a presentation and my face jolted to the side and I knew I had to stop the medication. It helped with my Intrusive thoughts and depression though so I’m sad I have to stop. Be aware if you develop a tic!

Horrible drug in my experience.I started this Lexapro for GAD.Dr started me on 10mg, I took it for 2 weeks and had shivers, sweating, no sex drive, insomnia, dry mouth, headaches, blurry vision, night terrors, dysphoria 12 hour panic attacks & suicidal thoughts.Returned to the doctor and they said because it had only been 2 weeks at 10mg  I could stop cold turkey and should be okay because the drug needs longer than that to really build up in the system. I’m on day 2 without taking it and although I don’t feel great yet I do feel much better. I can live with my anxiety but I absolutely cannot live with those side effects! I urge anyone thinking of starting this drug to think long and hard about it before starting!!

O boy!!! For past 8 years the doctor just kept prescribing lexapro to me. Not bad enough, now he switched it to zoloft(sertraline). Hello??? I ask for xanax only for me to take it in case of a panic attack. So, instead he wants me to start zoloft. No way I am gonna even start it!!! So now I am left with nothing with all the withdrawal symptoms on my own??? I feel like throwing up constantly, electric shocks all through my body. If the doctors to go through those withdrawal symptoms at least they will understand that they shouldn't be prescribing antidepressants to left and right!!!

I have GAD, dysthymia and ADD and have tried Effexor, Zoloft, Lexapro, Wellbutrin XL, Lamictal, Lyrica, Ritalin, Attentin, Vyvanse and Modafinil. I will definitely say that the most effective medication for me is Lexapro; it also has the least side-effects. The problems I have with Lexapro long term is lethargy, insomnia and some weight gain. The upside on Lexapro is way less anxiety, depression and rumination.

Developed severe anxiety after hearing loss and tinnitus caused by noise exposure from an accident at work. After 2.5 years I finally habituated from my tinnitus but was still left with severe anxiety. Spent the whole time trying to recover from anxiety without having to take meds. Tried everything from improving my diet, sleep, relaxation techniques etc but at that point my anxiety was so bad I couldn't recover from it without help. So finally decided to take lexapri after the doctors kept pushing it on me. Started off on 5mg with no side effects for the first week then increased to 10 mg the week after. 10 days in and after 2.5 years in I finally starting to feel normal again. This drug has been a real life saver for me. I can finally relax my body again and get a good night's sleep.

Have tried sertraline, paroxetine and mirtazapine for GAD/panic attacks and have to say Escitalopram is best, very effective with the least amount and least severe side effects! Did not cause sexual side effects! Feel calm but not sedated and still feel in touch with my emotions. Would highly recommend for anxiety! Greatly enhanced my life and  would not be without

Lexapro has given me my life back! Before taking Lexapro I couldn't drive, felt like I had someone sitting on my chest, couldn't eat at restaurants...now I look back at those times and cant imagine living like that again!

After being off of Lexapro for about 3 yrs & trying natural remedies I met my breaking point. All areas of my life were suffering. I restarted 5mg the 1st week, then 10mg the next 2 1/2 wks. The side effects during those 1st 3wks were horrible. Nausea, extreme fatigue, dizziness, & no appetite. I knew I would go back to square one if I stopped. I increased my dose to 20mg as I done very well on it in the past. The side effects were still there but not bad. 1 1/2 wks on 20mg. I feel great. More energy, feeling social w/ family & friends. Before I hated being around people. I still have a little longer 2 feel normal but I'll continue this med. Regardless of the horror stories u've heard, remember everyone is different & your body will most likely respond differently.I know it's hard not 2 get discouraged & question whether it's working the 1st few weeks, but don't give up & DON'T stop taking it. Give your body the chance 2 get used 2 it. Trust me, u will be glad u did.

I’ve been taking this medication for almost 3 weeks. I suffered from extremely bad anxiety and slight depression. My body would ache from the constant anxiety. This medication has help so much. I no longer have the extreme anxiety and body pains. I still have the thoughts that cause my anxiety but don’t feel the discomfort as much. I recommend this medication. There are some slight side effects but nothing extreme.

Back in May, I was having a pretty bad bout of anxiety. I was getting very little sleep. I had no appetite and my stomach always felt like it was in a knot. I had no desire to go out and socialize. After dealing with on and off anxiety/panic attacks for a decade, I decided I had enough. I started on 5mg Lexapro at the end of May.My doctor said it would take 4-6 weeks to fully work. By around week 4 I felt doubtful. I went on vacation and still had random nervousness.But I noticed small changes. In addition to GAD/panic disorder, I also had social anxiety. I never quite knew the extent of it until I started feeling Lexapro's full effects. I began to find it easy to make conversation with strangers. I found myself becoming more social. I'm less afraid to say what comes to my mind. I haven't felt the emotion of embarrassment in months now, which is something I'd struggle with. Lexapro has changed my life. I can truly say that I've become a better version of myself.

First off I would like to say I feel everybody’s pain , and you are not alone . I went through years of anxiety and panic. Lexapro has changed my life . I’m on day 10 and I already feel a HUGE DIFFERENCE. Please believe me when I say this , while on this drug it has to get worse before it gets better ( exactly what my doctor told me ) . I had massive side affects the first 6 days at least and then are finally starting to taper off on day 10. Do not give up on the drug. I used to have 10 heart palpitations a day and now I have MAYBE 1 and it has only been 10 days . I started with 5 mg and on day 7 I jumped up to 10 mg . Side affects included dizziness , nausea , headache , extreme panic , sweaty hands and feet . You need to let this pass and realize you are going to be fine and get through this . If you play the game mind over matter you will win and it can change your life . I feel all your pain and hope this review has at least pointed one person in the right direction.

I’ve actually been on Lexapro a few times. The second time around I was put on it for my anxiety issues and stress at work and Lexapro has been great. There isn’t a magic pill to fix any and everything but this has done its job well. Just don’t run out and procrastinate to pick up your prescription because after two days with out I would start to get moody and a little stressed. But I take it at night and it seems to help me fall a sleep. Best of luck!

For ten years I struggled with GAD and panic attacks.  I refused to take SSRI and tried natural products.  Nothing really worked on a permanent basis. It made me feel discouraged and at the end of my rope.  Finally I agreed to take Lexapro.  6 WEEKS later, I was back to my old self. I had not travelled for 8 years. One evening without telling my wife or son, I purchased plane tickets and a cruise for the family. I actually WANTED to go !  Everything changed. Now, it is not 100% perfect but pretty close. I have to watch how long I sleep (need to rest well) and what I eat and exercise a little bit.  Side effects were minor and did not last. Didn't lose my libido either.  I am grateful for this medication and will not want to stop it anytime soon if all of this continues the way it is. So...if you are in the same situation as me...and you have tried the natural way and it didn't work, maybe give this a try.  Good luck.

Hello beautiful people. I have been prescribed Escitalopram 10mg by my GP. I started of with 10mg. I suffer from PTSD, extreme anxiety, brain fog, lack of concentration, memory loss, low self esteem and on... First 0-18 hours after taking it I felt very awake, my pupils changed like I had sniffed a line of cocaine. It gave me huge energy boost. Then it turned to abdominal discomfort but nothing bad. Whole body felt weird and very uncomfortable with dizziness and shaking. Hours 18-24 I started to feel better . I took lemsip max to help with the discomfort a little bit and it got better. Still couldn't sleep and was very awake but yawned at the same time. Only slept 4 hours in the first day yet energized and very irritated. The symptoms eased after the first day but continued to be mild until day 5. It is totally worth it in the long run. Anxiety is a lot worse than a few days of lexapro side effects. If you suffer don't think twice. Take it and you will get better 2-4 weeks.

I’ve been on lexapro 20mg for three years, I was always an anxiety ridden person, but I did not realize just how normal I could feel until I started on lexapro. It truly changed my life. I wasn’t this jealous, angry, bitter person I had been ever since I can remember. I’ve tried coming off of it to see if my anxiety is controlled while not on it, and I can tell the moment I miss a dose or cut down; I become that angry person again. However, I do have sexual side effects and intense dreams, that’s fine with me because I also have so much happiness!

Helped in the first 3 weeks with some anxiety and rage too! However the intrusive thoughts are almost constant. Went from 5mg to 10mg back to 5mg. Can never fall asleep and it made want to drink alcohol constantly. I don't drink! I sure have been though. I'm stopping. Wish it would have worked I've been on this 2 months which is a long time spent on hoping an SSRI will work.

I have been battling with anxiety my entire life, but it became unbearable after a series of events. I was only able to take this medication for 5 days. I went from depressed (due to a previous medication) to severe anxiety. The second day taking it my skin was on fire, and I was super sweaty. I came to this site to read the reviews and all of the positive reviews gave me hope that the side affects would go away. However on day 5 I broke out in a rash, my doctor told me to stop talking it. I am hoping this leaves my system quick, I was only on 5mg. I wanted to write a review to let others know that a burning reaction isn't always a side effect. Also the positive reviews are amazing, I really wanted this medication to work for me.

I want to share my detailed experience so far with Lexapro because, let's be honest, anxiety is an awful beast.  I started experiencing panic attacks recently.  I kept thinking "I am not taking medicine." I can control this on my own. Well, in my case, that was wrong. I went to counselling and learned breathing techniques, which helped some but it did not prevent my panic in the middle of the night. After letting go of my pride, I decided to see the doctor about medicine.  For about 8 days I experienced different side effects---nausea, insomnia, headaches (some bad), and still some anxiety. DO NOT QUIT THIS MEDICINE.   Now, I am 2 weeks in on medicine. GUESS WHAT?!  FEELING AWESOME.  I am sleeping great now.  My anxiety is 99% gone. I feel like my happy self again. I thankful for this medicine and how it is helping me.

Lexapro changed my life. I used to feel overwhelmed by everything and could be thrown into a crying/screaming fit over very small issues. Within 3 days of taking Lexapro I felt better. I could handle situations and stress normally for the first time in years. I cycled off it after 1 year but found my symptoms returning and I've been back on it for a year now, 20mg/day. It really has been a life saver for me. Also it never caused me nausea like it does for some people so I'm thankful for that.

I've been on varying doses of Lexapro for about 3 or 4 years now. It was the first SSRI/any type of psychiatric med I tried. Luckily the first time was the charm. Except for a rough ~2 week start where I felt tired and nauseous, it's been amazing for my anxiety and rumination-prone mind. I went from sitting in the dark in my closet crying uncontrollably, sensitive to every perceived threat or comment, to being able to brush most things off easily. I also no longer replay every interaction in my mind thinking I my have offended someone. 10 mg Lexapro has been my "core" dose -- sometimes up to 20 mg. I'm about to go up to 15 mg due to increased anxiety and agoraphobia. Vyvanse (stimulant) is my other workhorse med. It's definitely more difficult to orgasm -- although I know my body well enough to remedy this when it's just me. I haven't had any issues with weight gain, either. Give it a try -- seems to be the least fussy anxiety/depression stabilizer out there!

I would say by far this has been the ticket. Postpartum, I experienced horrible anxiety with ruminations. Prozac made it worse, along with the exacerbated insomnia. I’m currently on 10mg of lexapro and I feel 80% better on just week 2. I’m also sleeping like a baby.

Lexapro saved my life! I was diagnosed with Generalized Anxiety Disorder and Major Depressive Disorder years ago. Lexapro was the first SSRI I've tried and it worked like wonder! I've been on 7.5mg for 4 years and increased to 15mg 6 months ago. The very first time and after the increased dosage, my anxiety always gets worse and I felt unsafe to be alone. After 2 weeks of taking Lexapro, depression starts to fade away and it took about 2 months to get the full effect! Now that I stable, I don't get panic attacks and anxiety at all!

I am a 20 year old female and recently my anxiety had gotten to the point where I was scared to leave my house. I had bad health anxiety so I couldn't go anywhere or drive my car without fear or a stroke or seizure. My doctor prescribed me Lexapro and I have only been on it for exactly a week, but I started seeing significant changes after day 3. This medication completely changed my life. I am now able to go and do things, workout, and drive wherever I please without my anxiety and OCD telling me I can't.
